Welcome to PrivacyBuddy. This app is a prototype designed to test a built-in OS service created by Tristan Pelgrims and Maxime Bellis for their thesis.

Choose a data file, the app will load into the privacy dashboard with the data you choose.

We invite you to explore the app as if you are reviewing your own data from the past week.
Precise: Uses GPS or similar services to access the device\'s exact location with high accuracy.
Approximate: Determines the general area of the device using Wi-Fi, cell towers, and less precise methods.
Foreground: Accesses location while the app doing the location access is in use.
Background: Accesses location in the background, without user interaction, like weather updates during other phone use.
Subliminal: Obtains location data when the phone is not in use, such as during sleep mode when the phone is resting on a table. When your phone is turned off completely, no accesses can be done.

Privacy scores require more than one day of data to ensure accuracy of the calculation.

Privacy Score is derived by analyzing daily app accesses: less frequent and less intrusive accesses lead to a higher score. Penalties are applied based on access type and frequency, reducing the base score of 100.
